org.jcvi.jillion.maq.bfq

Class BfqFileWriterBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvi.jillion.maq.bfq.BfqFileWriterBuilder

  • public class BfqFileWriterBuilder
extends Object
    BfqFileWriterBuilder is a builder class that will create a new FastqWriter instance that will write MAQ binary encoded fastq files (.bfq files). It is important to note that BFQ files only encode ACGT and N bases. Any bases that are not ACG or T are converted into N's and their quality values are set to 0. Furthermore, any quality values >63 will be capped at 63. This means that it is possible that writing a FastqRecord to the built writer which either has quality values > 63 or bases that are not ACG and T will not be written out the same.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Constructor Detail

      • BfqFileWriterBuilder

        public BfqFileWriterBuilder(File outputBfqFile)
        Create a new BfqFileWriterBuilder instance which will create a FastqWriter that will write to the given output File.
        Parameters:
        outputBfqFile - the output bfq file to write to; can not be null. If this file already exists, then it will be overwritten. If the file or any parent directories do not yet exist, then they will be created when build() is called.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if outputBfqFile is null.

    • Method Detail

      • endian

        public BfqFileWriterBuilder endian(ByteOrder endian)
        Force the writer to use the given ByteOrder. If this method is not used, then the system default endian will be used. MAQ uses the default endian of the machine it is run on so if you wish to use bfq files produced by this writer in MAQ then you will need to make sure the endian matches the endian the target machine MAQ will run on.
        Parameters:
        endian - the endian to use; can not be null.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if endian is null.

      • build

        public FastqWriter build()
                  throws IOException
        Create a new FastqWriter instance that will write Binary Fastq encoded data to the given output file.
        Returns:
        a new FastqWriter instance will never be null.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem creating the file or any parent directory or opening the file for writing.
